We begin by determining **who is East** by rolling the dice. The tiles are dealt from **East**'s wall first. This will rotate each round.

Here is how the deal works:

1.  **East** will roll the dice to **break the wall** (this is like cutting the deck in cards). You break the wall by counting the number rolled from the right side of the wall. These tiles are left behind, you then "push" the remaining tiles in wall forward and deal from those.
2.  **East takes the first tiles** and then the deal continues **counter-clockwise**. Each player takes two stacks of tiles (4 titles total) until all players have **12 tiles**
3.  After the final player (**North**) has 12 tiles, **East** takes the first and third tile from the top of the wall -- they will now have **14 tiles**. Then the remaining players each take **1 tile**, they will each have **13 tiles**.
